summary: This drink is very popular in Canada. Take a lick of the celery salt and then a drink of the Caesar through the straw for the proper Caesar experience.
ingredient: 1 lime wedge + 1 tablespoon celery salt, or as needed + ice cubes, as needed + 1 fluid ounce vodka + 1 dash Worcestershire sauce, or to taste + 1 dash hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®), or to taste + 8 fluid ounces tomato and clam juice cocktail (such as Clamato®) + 1 celery stick

name: Spicy Red Snapper (Bloody Mary with Gin)
summary: I've tried many variations, and decided that these ingredients make the very best Red Snapper out there. It is now my go-to drink, and friends absolutely love it - even those who don't like gin. Careful! Your lips might burn, but it sure goes down easy...
process: prep: 10 mins,total: 10 mins,Servings: 1,Yield: 1 spicy red snapper
ingredient: 5 ice cubes + 1 (6 fluid ounce) can tomato juice + 2 fluid ounces dry gin + 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice + 2 teaspoons hot pepper sauce + 2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce + ½ teaspoon brine from olive jar + 1 pinch hot chili powder + 1 pinch garlic powder + 1 pinch ground cumin + ¼ teaspoon celery salt + ¼ teaspoon fresh-ground black pepper + ¼ teaspoon prepared horseradish + 1 celery stalk + 1 small dill pickle + 2 stuffed green olives + 1 wedge lemon

name: True Wisconsin Bloody Mary
summary: This is my Wisconsin version of a classic Bloody Mary drink. On special occasions, garnish with skewered bite-size pieces of Wisconsin Cheddar, Monterey Jack, pepperoni, salami, green olives or cocktail shrimp on top. Best when consumed before noon.
ingredient: 4 ice cubes + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger vodka + 3 pimento-stuffed green olives + 1 tablespoon brine from olive jar + ½ teaspoon celery salt + ½ teaspoon ground black pepper + 3 dashes Dash Worcestershire sauce + 3 dashes hot pepper sauce (e.g. Texas Pete's™) + 1 cup tomato and clam juice cocktail + 1 stalk celery, with leaves

name: Al's Bloody Marys
summary: Al was my stepdad, who was a wonderful man and a great cook! One of his specialties was his Bloody Mary, and no matter how many pitchers he prepared for company, they always wanted more. My only modification has been to add a bit of horseradish. This is a great brunch beverage, but various friends always ask if I'll please make 'Al's Bloodys' when they come for dinner.
ingredient: 16 fluid ounces vodka + 2 cups tomato juice (such as Sacramento®) + 2 cups tomato and clam juice cocktail (such as Clamato®) + 1 lemon, juiced + 1 lime, juiced + 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce, or to taste + 1 tablespoon prepared horseradish, or to taste + 2 teaspoons finely ground black pepper, or to taste + 1<U+2009>½ teaspoons hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®), or to taste + 1 teaspoon celery salt, or to taste + ice + 1 lime, cut into wedges, or as needed

name: Classic Bloody Mary
summary: A Bloody Mary is easy to make from scratch with vodka, tomato juice, and a few other simple ingredients. The spicy, salty, and savory taste of this classic cocktail makes it perfect for brunch or other afternoon gatherings.
ingredient: 1 teaspoon sea salt, or as needed + ice cubes, as needed + ¾ cup spicy tomato-vegetable juice cocktail (such as V8®) + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger vodka + 2 dashes Worcestershire sauce + 1 dash hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®) + salt and ground black pepper to taste + 1 stalk celery + 2 garlic-stuffed green olives, threaded onto a toothpick

name: Bloody Mary Cocktail
summary: This lively eye-opener adds a spicy kick to brunch.
ingredient: 1<U+2009>½ cups ice cubes + 4 fluid ounces tomato juice + 1<U+2009>½ fluid ounces vodka + ¼ fluid ounce fresh lemon juice + 4 dashes hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®) + 2 dashes Worcestershire sauce + 1 pinch salt and ground black pepper + ice + 1 stalk celery, for garnish

name: Bloody Mary Mix
summary: My sister got this recipe from a restaurant in Ohio and all our family loves it. This is very spicy and needs time to blend flavors.
process: prep: 5 mins,additional: 8 hrs,total: 8 hrs 5 mins,Servings: 8,Yield: 8 (6 ounce) servings
ingredient: 1 (46 fluid ounce) bottle tomato-vegetable juice cocktail + 1<U+2009>½ fruit, without seeds lemons, juiced + 1 teaspoon brown sugar + 1 tablespoon steak sauce + 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce + 1 teaspoon prepared horseradish + 1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce + ½ teaspoon celery salt

name: Spicy Bloody Mary Mix
summary: My father-in-law first introduced me to this homemade bloody mary mix. It is very similar to what you'd buy in a store. Made as is, it is very spicy. You can customize it to your taste by cutting back on the pepper and hot sauce; I like about half the pepper and hot sauce. Enjoy this wonderful mix! It is so easy and much cheaper than buying pre-made mix.
ingredient: 1 (46 fluid ounce) can tomato juice + ½ (10.5 ounce) can condensed beef consomme (such as Campbell's ®) + 3 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce + 1 tablespoon lemon juice + 1 tablespoon hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®) + 1 tablespoon celery salt + 1 tablespoon ground black pepper

name: Clamato® Bloody Caesar
summary: Taste the savory Clamato® Bloody Caesar. One of our original recipes.
ingredient: 4 ounces Clamato® Tomato Cocktail + 1 ounce vodka + 4 dashes Worcestershire sauce + 2 dashes hot sauce + 3 pinches kosher salt & chili powder + 1 fresh celery stick + 1 wedge lime for garnish

name: Homemade Bloody Mary Mix
summary: Mother-in-law gave me this recipe. It tastes better then the name brand store stuff. Spice it up or down to your tastes. Chill and mix with desired amount of vodka and ice.
ingredient: 1 (46 fluid ounce) can tomato juice + ¼ cup lime juice + 3 tablespoons pickled jalapeno pepper juice + 3 tablespoons vinegar + 2 tablespoons white sugar + 1<U+2009>½ tablespoons Worcestershire sauce + 2 teaspoons prepared horseradish + ¼ teaspoon salt + ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper + ¼ teaspoon ground cloves + <U+215B> teaspoon onion powder + 1 pinch garlic powder

name: The Real Mojito
summary: This is an authentic recipe for mojito. I sized the recipe for one serving, but you can adjust it accordingly and make a pitcher full. It's a very refreshing drink for hot summer days. Be careful when drinking it, however. If you make a pitcher you might be tempted to drink the whole thing yourself, and you just might find yourself talking Spanish in no time!
ingredient: 10 fresh mint leaves + ½ medium lime, cut into 3 wedges, divided + 2 tablespoons white sugar, or to taste + 1 cup ice cubes, or as needed + 1<U+2009>½ fluid ounces white rum + ½ cup club soda, or as needed

name: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
summary: There are a few impostors out there that claim to be Long Island Iced Teas. In actuality, there is only one correct way to make a LIIT... and this is it!
ingredient: ½ fluid ounce vodka + ½ fluid ounce rum + ½ fluid ounce gin + ½ fluid ounce tequila + ½ fluid ounce triple sec (orange-flavored liqueur) + 1 fluid ounce sweet and sour mix + 1 fluid ounce cola, or to taste + 1 lemon slice

name: Pineapple Sunrise Mimosas
summary: These simple, sweet mimosas are great for brunch. For a virgin version, substitute club soda or citrus-flavored sparkling water for the prosecco, and use grenadine instead of Campari.
process: prep: 10 mins,additional: 2 hrs,total: 2 hrs 10 mins,Servings: 12,Yield: 12 servings
ingredient: 4<U+2009>½ cups pineapple juice + 1<U+2009><U+215B> cups orange juice + <U+2153> cup lime juice + ¼ fresh pineapple, sliced + ½ blood orange, sliced + ½ lime, sliced + 1 (750 milliliter) bottle Prosecco (Italian sparkling wine) + ¼ cup Campari + 4 slices pineapple and orange slices, for garnish

name: Parker's Famous Margaritas
summary: This is the signature drink at my in-law's home. My father-in-law developed a taste for margaritas made from scratch during the summer they spent in Zihuatanejo during the 1960s. After decades of tinkering he has arrived at this foolproof recipe for the ultimate Mexican cocktail.
ingredient: 5 fluid ounces tequila + 3 fluid ounces fresh lime juice + 1 fluid ounce sweetened lime juice + 3 fluid ounces triple sec (orange-flavored liqueur) + ice cubes + 1 lime, cut into wedges + rimming salt

name: Grilled Grapefruit Paloma Cocktail
summary: Here's a fired up twist on a traditional Mexican cocktail. You'll grill the grapefruit and lime to caramelize the fruit and give the juice a subtle smoky edge. Stir it up with tequila or mescal and top with club soda for a refreshing drink that's perfect all summer long.
ingredient: 2 limes + ¼ cup white sugar + 1 red grapefruit, halved widthwise + ¼ cup kosher salt + 1 cup ice cubes, or as needed + 4 fluid ounces tequila + 2 tablespoons simple syrup, or to taste + 4 fluid ounces club soda

name: Bikini Martini
summary: An awesome drink to sip by the pool! Garnish with an orange wheel.
ingredient: 1 fluid ounce coconut rum + ¾ fluid ounce vodka + 1 fluid ounce pineapple juice + 1 dash grenadine syrup

name: Sangria! Sangria!
summary: The best sangria recipe I've been able to hone to perfection for summer parties! I like to use a fruity Spanish red wine, such as Garnacha.
ingredient: 1 (750 milliliter) bottle dry red wine + ½ cup brandy + ½ cup triple sec + <U+2153> cup frozen lemonade concentrate + <U+2153> cup orange juice + ¼ cup lemon juice + ¼ cup white sugar (Optional) + 1 medium orange, sliced into rounds + 1 medium lemon, sliced into rounds + 1 medium lime, sliced into rounds + 8 maraschino cherries + 2 cups carbonated water (Optional)

name: Mint Juleps
summary: Sit on the front porch in your rocking chair on a sultry afternoon and sip on one or two of these. The proper way to serve a mint julep is in a frozen silver goblet, but you can use glasses instead - just use the most elegant ones you have! You can make the syrup ahead of time and store it in the refrigerator for whenever the julep mood strikes you.
ingredient: 2 cups water + 2 cups white sugar + ½ cup roughly chopped fresh mint leaves + 32 fluid ounces Kentucky bourbon + 8 sprigs fresh mint leaves for garnish

name: Rob and Becky's Pimm's Lemonade
summary: Pimm's and lemonade is a refreshing and easy summer drink. On our honeymoon we stayed with some friends in London and they made us this drink - now we can't stop making it! It is especially delicious on a hot, summer afternoon. Don't leave the cucumber and mint out - they make this drink!
ingredient: 1 cup Pimm's No. 1™ (gin-based liqueur) + 2 quarts lemonade + 1 (4 inch) wedge of cucumber + 1 red apple, cored and thinly sliced + 1 orange, sliced + ½ lemon, sliced + ½ lime, sliced + 2 slices fresh pineapple + 2 strawberries, sliced + 3 leaves fresh mint

name: Beer Margaritas
summary: Who would believe that beer would be the perfect solution to eradicating fluorescent green margaritas? Well, it is! Best to use not-so-micro brews to avoid an overpowering beer flavor. Use the limeade can to measure the ingredients, and adjust with extra water if the mixture seems too sweet. Straining the pulp is always a good idea, unless, of course, you like pulp!
ingredient: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate + 12 fluid ounces tequila + 12 fluid ounces water + 12 fluid ounces beer + ice + 1 lime, cut into wedges

name: Mai Tai
summary: This Mai Tai is made with two flavors of rum mixed with pineapple juice and orange juice to make a yummy, fruity drink.
ingredient: 1 cup ice cubes + 3 fluid ounces pineapple juice + 2 fluid ounces orange juice + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger spiced rum + ½ (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger coconut-flavored rum + 1 teaspoon grenadine syrup

name: The Real Mojito
summary: This is an authentic recipe for mojito. I sized the recipe for one serving, but you can adjust it accordingly and make a pitcher full. It's a very refreshing drink for hot summer days. Be careful when drinking it, however. If you make a pitcher you might be tempted to drink the whole thing yourself, and you just might find yourself talking Spanish in no time!
ingredient: 10 fresh mint leaves + ½ medium lime, cut into 3 wedges, divided + 2 tablespoons white sugar, or to taste + 1 cup ice cubes, or as needed + 1<U+2009>½ fluid ounces white rum + ½ cup club soda, or as needed

name: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
summary: The Blue Hawaiian is a fun, refreshing cocktail made with rum, cream of coconut, pineapple juice, and Curacao liqueur to create its signature blue color. Invented in Hawaii in the 1950s, this tiki cocktail will have you crooning like Elvis!
ingredient: 1 cup crushed ice + 2 fluid ounces pineapple juice + 1 fluid ounce light rum + 1 fluid ounce blue Curacao liqueur + 1 fluid ounce cream of coconut + 1 pineapple slice + 1 maraschino cherry

name: Ultimate Frozen Strawberry Margarita
summary: A strawberry margarita is the perfect summer cocktail! Made with frozen strawberries and limeade concentrate, this 5-ingredient margarita is ready to refresh you in just minutes. For an extra-sweet presentation, dip the rims of your margarita glasses in powdered sugar.
ingredient: 2 cups ice cubes, or as needed + 6 fluid ounces tequila + 2 fluid ounces triple sec + 8 ounces frozen sliced strawberries in syrup + 4 fluid ounces frozen limeade concentrate

name: Tom Collins Cocktail
summary: The Tom Collins was created in the late 1800s and is said to have been named after a widespread practical joke that swept the country. This cocktail, however, is no joke.
ingredient: 2<U+2009>½ cups ice, divided + 2 fluid ounces gin + ¾ fluid ounce lemon juice + ½ fluid ounce simple syrup + 2 fluid ounces club soda + 1 lemon wedge

name: The Perfect Margarita
summary: With the right margarita ingredients (fresh limes and high-quality tequila and triple sec) and the right ratios, you can easily master the best margarita! The classic recipe is 3 parts tequila, 2 parts triple sec, and 1 part freshly squeezed lime juice (3:2:1), and you should probably start off pretty close to that. My favorite ratio for a perfect margarita is 4:3:2.
ingredient: 1 wedge lime + 1 teaspoon coarse sea salt, or as needed + 1 large ice cube + 1 cup ice cubes, or as needed + 2 fluid ounces white tequila + 1<U+2009>½ fluid ounces triple sec + 1 fluid ounce freshly squeezed lime juice + 1 slice lime

name: Mojitos by the Pitcher
summary: I have served this mojito pitcher recipe to people who have sworn that they dislike mojitos and they love it. I believe it is the fresh ingredients and the use of sugar, instead of simple syrup, muddled together that makes this cocktail refreshing and delicious. It takes a little bit of work but the results are well worth it. Serve over ice.
ingredient: ½ cup white sugar + 36 leaves fresh mint, or to taste + 3 limes, quartered + 1 cup rum (such as Bacardi®) + 1 liter club soda

name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
summary: The cosmopolitan cocktail, typically referred to as the "cosmo," gained popularity during the 1990s when it was frequently mentioned on the television show Sex and the City. The combination of vodka, orange liqueur, lime juice, and cranberry juice have made it a timeless classic.
ingredient: 1<U+2009>½ fluid ounces vodka + ¼ fluid ounce lime juice + ¼ fluid ounce triple sec + ¼ fluid ounce cranberry juice + 1 cup ice + 1 lime wedge for garnish

name: Classic Bloody Mary
summary: A Bloody Mary is easy to make from scratch with vodka, tomato juice, and a few other simple ingredients. The spicy, salty, and savory taste of this classic cocktail makes it perfect for brunch or other afternoon gatherings.
ingredient: 1 teaspoon sea salt, or as needed + ice cubes, as needed + ¾ cup spicy tomato-vegetable juice cocktail (such as V8®) + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger vodka + 2 dashes Worcestershire sauce + 1 dash hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®) + salt and ground black pepper to taste + 1 stalk celery + 2 garlic-stuffed green olives, threaded onto a toothpick

name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
summary: A vodka martini is a classic cocktail and easy to make with just vodka, dry vermouth, and ice. Serve in a chilled martini glass and garnish with olives or a lemon twist for an elegant cocktail at home.
ingredient: 3 fluid ounces vodka + 1 fluid ounce dry vermouth + 1 cup ice cubes + 3 small olives

name: Dirty Martini
summary: This is a dirty martini for olive lovers. It can be served on the rocks or chilled.
ingredient: 6 fluid ounces vodka + 1 dash dry vermouth + 1 fluid ounce brine from olive jar + 4 stuffed green olives

name: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
summary: This virgin strawberry daiquiri is probably the best drink I have ever had in my life! Easy to make with strawberries, sugar, lemon-lime soda, lemon juice, and ice. You can substitute red cream soda or your favorite flavor for the lemon-lime.
ingredient: 2 large strawberries, hulled + ¼ cup white sugar + ¾ cup chilled lemon-lime soda + 1 tablespoon lemon juice + 4 cubes ice

name: Margaritas
summary: I have been asked by everyone, 'How do you make your margaritas?' Everyone says I make the best. I like them, maybe you will too.
ingredient: 1 (6 ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate + 6 fluid ounces tequila + 2 fluid ounces triple sec

name: Strawberry Mojito
summary: I had this drink at a popular chain restaurant and decided to try it at home. I have served it at a couple different gatherings now and it has always been given rave reviews. It's the perfect drink for a hot summer day!
ingredient: white sugar, for rimming + 2 large limes, quartered + ½ bunch mint leaves + 7 strawberries, quartered + 1 cup white sugar + 1 cup white rum + 2 cups club soda + 8 cups ice cubes

name: The Real Rum Runner
summary: This rum runner recipe is straight from the Florida Keys, where it was originally concocted in the 1950s.
ingredient: 2 cups ice, divided, or as needed + 1 fluid ounce pineapple juice + 1 fluid ounce orange juice + 1 fluid ounce blackberry liqueur + 1 fluid ounce banana liqueur + 1 fluid ounce light rum + 1 fluid ounce dark rum + 1 splash grenadine syrup, or more to taste + 1 fluid ounce high-proof rum (such as Bacardi®151) + 1 slice orange

name: Budget Jungle Juice for a Crowd
summary: This jungle juice recipe makes a great alcoholic punch that will serve many on a limited budget. Serve chilled or add vanilla ice cream if you wish.
ingredient: 2 gallons orange-flavored drink + 4 quarts pink lemonade + 4 quarts pineapple and orange juice blend + 4 (750 milliliter) bottles vodka + 2 (750 milliliter) bottles white rum + 2 (46 fluid ounce) cans fruit punch

name: Classic Canadian Caesar
summary: This drink is very popular in Canada. Take a lick of the celery salt and then a drink of the Caesar through the straw for the proper Caesar experience.
ingredient: 1 lime wedge + 1 tablespoon celery salt, or as needed + ice cubes, as needed + 1 fluid ounce vodka + 1 dash Worcestershire sauce, or to taste + 1 dash hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®), or to taste + 8 fluid ounces tomato and clam juice cocktail (such as Clamato®) + 1 celery stick

name: Fuzzy Navel Slush
summary: This is a great slush for those who enjoy the drink by the same name.
ingredient: 9 cups water + 1<U+2009>½ cups white sugar + 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate + 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate + 1 pint peach schnapps + 1 (2 liter) bottle lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage

name: Old Fashioned Cocktail
summary: The earliest version of this cocktail was simply water, sugar, bitters, and booze. Over time, the water became ice, the booze became whiskey, and the drink became an old fashioned.
ingredient: 1 sugar cube + 1 teaspoon water + 1 dash bitters + 2 fluid ounces whiskey (rye or bourbon) + 1 lemon twist + ice cubes + 1 orange slice, for garnish + 1 maraschino cherry, for garnish

name: Perky Pineapple Sipper
summary: This delicious drink is inspired by the flavors of a 1960s cocktail, the Mr. Bali Hai, which usually requires simple syrup, pineapple juice, and three bottles of booze (two rums and a coffee liqueur). For a neat cheat, I coffee-washed a gold aged rum and made the simple syrup right in the shaker. Garnish with pineapple fronds and lime wedges.
ingredient: ¼ cup white sugar + ¼ cup water + 2 tablespoons ground coffee beans + ½ cup gold rum + 5 ounces pineapple juice + 1<U+2009>¼ cups freshly squeezed lemon juice + 3 cups crushed ice

name: Frozen Strawberry Margarita
summary: We serve these when friends come over and they are always sure to liven up a party!
ingredient: 6 fluid ounces tequila + 2 fluid ounces triple sec + 8 ounces frozen strawberries + 4 fluid ounces frozen limeade concentrate + 6 cups ice

name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
summary: After tweaking with several other margarita recipes, I finally found a way to get that 'real' margarita taste in a pitcher size for parties.
ingredient: 2 cups tequila + 1 cup triple sec + ¾ cup fresh lime juice + ¾ cup sweetened lime juice + 3 cups ice + kosher salt + 8 lime wedges

name: Berrylicious Frozen Sangria Slush
summary: This boozy, fruity frozen sangria is an adult version of the icy slushies we slurped down as kids. So refreshing on a hot summer night. Cheers!
ingredient: 1 cup red wine + 1 cup ice cubes, crushed + <U+2153> cup frozen blueberries + <U+2153> cup fresh raspberries + <U+2153> cup frozen strawberries + ¼ cup orange-flavored liqueur + ½ orange, juiced + 1 tablespoon white sugar, or more to taste

name: Beer Margaritas
summary: Who would believe that beer would be the perfect solution to eradicating fluorescent green margaritas? Well, it is! Best to use not-so-micro brews to avoid an overpowering beer flavor. Use the limeade can to measure the ingredients, and adjust with extra water if the mixture seems too sweet. Straining the pulp is always a good idea, unless, of course, you like pulp!
ingredient: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate + 12 fluid ounces tequila + 12 fluid ounces water + 12 fluid ounces beer + ice + 1 lime, cut into wedges

name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake in a Glass
summary: Cake-flavored vodka just may be the best thing in a bottle; it tastes great mixed with just about anything. This yummy cocktail combines the flavored vodka with pineapple juice for a sweet treat. Fresh pineapple also makes a great garnish.
ingredient: ice + 1 splash grenadine syrup + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger cake-flavored vodka + 3 ounces pineapple juice + 1 maraschino cherry

name: Grasshopper Cocktail
summary: This grasshopper drink is like a chocolate after-dinner mint in a glass. Skip dessert and go straight for this cocktail.
ingredient: ¾ fluid ounce creme de menthe + ¾ fluid ounce white creme de cacao + ¼ fluid ounce heavy cream + 1 cup ice

name: Starbucks Caramel Frappuccino Copycat Recipe
summary: This is my version of Starbucks Caramel Frappuccino! It's easy to make at home by blending coffee with milk, caramel sauce, and ice. Top each glass with whipped cream and drizzle more caramel sauce on top. Serve with a straw.
ingredient: 2 cups ice + 1 cup strongly brewed black coffee, cooled + 1 cup low-fat milk + <U+2153> cup caramel sauce + 3 tablespoons white sugar

name: Cappuccino Cooler
summary: The combination of coffee, chocolate ice cream, chocolate syrup and whipped cream makes this a perfect pick-me-up drink!
ingredient: 1<U+2009>½ cups cold coffee + 1<U+2009>½ cups chocolate ice cream + ¼ cup chocolate syrup + crushed ice + 1 cup whipped cream

name: Mayan Mocha Powder
summary: Years ago I worked in a little coffee shop. We had a powdered cocoa mix with spices that was called Mexican Spiced Cocoa. On the can were directions for mixing it with espresso to get Mayan Mocha. I fell IN LOVE with that drink and have been searching for a replacement ever since. The coffee shop inside Hastings has a similar drink, but won't sell the mix to me for home use. So I researched a little, tested a little, and came up with this. To serve, stir 1/4 cup mix with 1 cup hot water and stir.
ingredient: <U+2154> cup nonfat dry milk powder + <U+2154> cup instant coffee granules + 1<U+2009><U+2153> cups white sugar + <U+2153> cup unsweetened cocoa powder + 1<U+2009>½ teaspoons pumpkin pie spice + ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon + ¼ teaspoon ground red pepper

name: Cold-Brewed Coffee
summary: Coffee brewed slowly in cold water is less acidic than hot brewed. You can use this concentrate straight over ice or microwave half a mug coffee and then add a half cup of boiling water for quick hot coffee. Develop your own ratio of coffee to water for your custom brew.
process: prep: 10 mins,additional: 18 hrs,total: 18 hrs 10 mins,Servings: 6,Yield: 6 servings
ingredient: ½ pound coarsely ground coffee beans + 4<U+2009>½ cups cold water + cheesecloth + coffee filters

name: Iced Mochas
summary: All of my friends rave about these frosty drinks. I pour my leftover coffee in ice cube trays and keep them on hand all the time. You can make fun squiggly designs on insides of glasses with chocolate syrup, before pouring mochas. Top with whipped cream.
process: prep: 5 mins,additional: 1 day,total: 1 day 5 mins,Servings: 4,Yield: 4 servings
ingredient: 1<U+2009>½ cups cold coffee + 2 cups milk + ¼ cup chocolate syrup + ¼ cup white sugar

name: Sous Vide "Cold Brew" Coffee
summary: This method mimics the traditional time-consuming method of making cold-brew coffee in the fridge, but in 2 hours instead of 24! The warm water temperature is kept low enough to speed up the cold-brew process, but not hot enough to release the bitter, acidic flavors you get from hot-brewed drip coffee. The result is a super smooth brew that you'll want to make again and again. Use your favorite fresh-ground coffee for best results.
process: prep: 10 mins,cook: 2 hrs,total: 2 hrs 10 mins,Servings: 8,Yield: 8 coffee drinks
ingredient: 1 cup coarsely ground coffee + 4 (16-ounce) Mason jars + 8 cups water

name: Easy Iced Coffee
summary: Learn how to make iced coffee with this iced coffee recipe! We use instant coffee in this cheater-version of iced cappuccino that's very easy to make, and very nice to drink!
ingredient: 3 tablespoons warm water + 2 teaspoons instant coffee granules + 1 teaspoon sugar + 1 cup ice, or as needed + 6 fluid ounces cold milk

name: Flavored Latte
summary: Use this basic recipe to make your favorite flavored latte with a home espresso machine.
ingredient: 1<U+2009>¼ cups 2% milk + 2 tablespoons any flavor of flavored syrup + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger brewed espresso

name: Irish Coffee
summary: Fresh hot coffee gets a little added pep with the addition of Irish whiskey and Irish cream.
ingredient: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger Irish cream liqueur + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger Irish whiskey + 1 cup hot brewed coffee + 1 tablespoon whipped cream + 1 dash ground nutmeg

name: Cafe Latte
summary: This latte is for all fellow coffee drinkers. I love cafe lattes but buying them can be pricey. So here's a recipe so you can make your own.
ingredient: 2 cups milk + 1<U+2009><U+2153> cups hot freshly brewed dark roast espresso coffee

name: Mexican Coffee Cocktail
summary: Not to be outdone by the Irish, Mexico has a spiked coffee of its own. Coffee liqueur and tequila give this warming drink quite a kick.
ingredient: 1 fluid ounce coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®) + ½ fluid ounce tequila + 5 fluid ounces hot coffee + 2 tablespoons whipped cream

name: Coffee Shake
summary: This is a blended-coffee treat much like an iced cappuccino you might buy at a restaurant. You can make it non-dairy by using soy milk.
ingredient: 1 teaspoon instant coffee granules + ¾ cup milk + 1 teaspoon vanilla extract + 2 teaspoons white sugar, or to taste + 6 ice cubes + 2 teaspoons chocolate syrup (Optional)

name: Frozen Caramel Coffee
summary: Who knew caramel syrup, milk, and Gevaliau0026reg; Cold Brew Concentrate could blend together with ice to make such a delicious summer or anytime beverage?
ingredient: ½ cup Gevalia® Cold Brew Concentrate - Vanilla + ½ cup whole milk + 2 tablespoons caramel ice cream topping + 2 teaspoons white sugar, or to taste + 8 ice cubes + 1 tablespoon whipped topping (such as Cool Whip®) + 2 teaspoons caramel ice cream topping, or to taste

name: Affogato
summary: Crafting the perfect affogato is more than meets the eye. In fact, there's more science to the dessert than most would care to acknowledge. Using gelato boosts the incredible flavor, and gives a velvety, silky smoothness ice cream just doesn't have. This is because gelato has a lower fat content, less air, and is served at a different temperature than ice cream. Translation: if you use ice cream you'll end up with something less than perfect as the hot espresso will cause the ice cream to melt faster.
ingredient: 5<U+2009>½ ounces vanilla gelato + 2 ounces fresh brewed espresso

name: Vanilla Latte
summary: This is an easy espresso drink to make with your home espresso machine--steamed milk and a shot of espresso with vanilla flavoring.
ingredient: 1<U+2009>¼ cups 2% milk + 2 tablespoons vanilla flavored syrup + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger brewed espresso

name: Dalgona Coffee (Whipped Coffee)
summary: The trending South Korean coffee drink that has gone viral on social media during the Coronavirus epidemic.
ingredient: 2 tablespoons boiling water + 2 tablespoons instant coffee + 2 tablespoons white sugar + 1 cup whole milk

name: Spanish Coffee
summary: Great alcoholic coffee drink for cold nights.
ingredient: 1<U+2009>½ teaspoons superfine sugar + 1 fluid ounce 151-proof rum + ¾ fluid ounce triple sec (such as Bols®) + 2<U+2009>½ fluid ounces coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®) + ½ cup freshly brewed coffee

name: Coffee Liqueur
summary: This is an easy recipe for making a coffee flavored liqueur. This can be used in any recipe that calls for coffee flavored liqueur, as a cordial alone, mixed with milk or more vodka, etc.
process: prep: 15 mins,cook: 10 mins,additional: 35 mins,total: 1 hr,Servings: 32,Yield: 8 cups
ingredient: 4 cups white sugar + 4 cups water + ¾ cup instant coffee granules + 2 tablespoons vanilla extract + 4 cups vodka

name: Homemade Vanilla Coffee Creamer
summary: I love cream in my coffee, but I was tired of using scary non-foods in it. Here is what I came up with.
ingredient: 1 pint fat-free half-and-half + 1 (14 ounce) can fat-free sweetened condensed milk + 1 teaspoon cinnamon + 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

name: Homemade Coffee Creamer (Pumpkin Spice)
summary: Why buy expensive name-brand coffee creamers when it's this easy to make even better tasting ones?
ingredient: 14 ounces heavy whipping cream, divided + ¼ cup maple syrup + 3 tablespoons pumpkin puree + 1 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice + 1 teaspoon vanilla extract + 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk

name: Banana Milk Coffee
summary: Adding creamy smooth banana milk to your morning cold brew makes it taste rich and delicious. Talk about an eye-opening good-for-you breakfast in a cup!
ingredient: 1 cup milk + 1 very ripe banana + 1 tablespoon simple syrup + ice cubes + 1 cup cold brew coffee

name: Coffee Nudge
summary: So good on a blustery day! Warms you from the inside out.
ingredient: 8 cups hot brewed coffee + 8 fluid ounces coffee flavored liqueur + 8 fluid ounces brandy + 4 fluid ounces creme de cacao + 2 cups whipped cream, garnish + 2 tablespoons chocolate sprinkles

name: Homemade Caramel Latte
summary: Homemade caramel latte.
ingredient: ½ cup milk + 1 tablespoon brown sugar + 1 tablespoon sugar-free caramel topping + 1 tablespoon caramel sauce + ¼ teaspoon vanilla extract + 1 cup coffee

name: Baileys Flat White Martini
summary: Let's rethink the classic Martini by adding espresso and Baileys Original Irish Cream!
ingredient: 2 ounces Baileys® Original Irish Cream + Ice + 1 ounce vodka + 1 ounce brewed espresso

name: Chocolate-y Iced Mocha
summary: My favorite morning drink that isn't a diet disaster.
ingredient: 1<U+2009>¼ cups cold coffee, divided + 1 envelope low-calorie hot cocoa mix + ice cubes, or as needed + ½ cup unsweetened almond milk + 2 tablespoons sugar-free chocolate syrup, or more to taste

name: White Chocolate Mocha
summary: This is a white chocolate version of a classic mocha. No reason to head to the cafe--stay in and use your home espresso machine to brew up this delicious espresso drink.
ingredient: 1<U+2009>¼ cups 2% milk + 2 tablespoons white chocolate flavored syrup + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger brewed espresso + 1 tablespoon sweetened whipped cream (Optional)

name: Mocha
summary: This is a chocolate and coffee-lover's favorite! Using a home espresso machine, mix espresso, chocolate, and steamed milk--then top with whipped cream.
ingredient: 1<U+2009>¼ cups 2% milk + 2 tablespoons chocolate syrup + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger brewed espresso + 1 tablespoon sweetened whipped cream (Optional)

name: Irish Cream and Coffee
summary: The best after-dinner drink! Just use Irish Cream instead of cream and sugar - how easy is that?!
ingredient: 1 cup strong brewed coffee + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger Irish cream liqueur

name: Vanilla Coffee Creamer
summary: Simple, basic coffee creamer recipe. Store in the refrigerator for 1 week.
ingredient: 2 cups half-and-half + 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk + 2 teaspoons vanilla extract

name: Sara's Iced Coffee
summary: Wonderful iced coffee with vanilla flavoring — just like you'd get at Tim Hortons! Perfect for hot summer days.
ingredient: ½ teaspoon vanilla extract (Optional) + ¼ cup white sugar + ¼ cup boiling water + 3 cups crushed ice + 4 cups brewed coffee, chilled + ½ cup cream

name: Pumpkin Spiced Latte
summary: My husband is obsessed with Starbucks® Pumpkin Spice Lattes! I created this recipe so we wouldn't have to go broke. I've made these countless times for everyone who visits. I think I've actually become famous for these within our very-extended family. No espresso machine is needed.
ingredient: 3 cups hot whole milk + 4 teaspoons white sugar + ½ teaspoon vanilla extract + ½ teaspoon pumpkin pie spice + 6 ounces double-strength brewed coffee + 3 tablespoons sweetened whipped cream + 3 pinches pumpkin pie spice

name: Abbey's White Chocolate Latte
summary: I created this recipe for my little sister, Abbey, who's a latte fanatic. She was blown away, and drained it to the last drop! This makes one VERY large, indulgent latte, and could probably serve two. Enjoy!
ingredient: 1<U+2009>½ cups milk + 1 tablespoon heavy cream + <U+215B> teaspoon vanilla extract + 1 tablespoon white sugar + ½ cup brewed espresso + ¼ cup white chocolate chips, chopped

name: Thai Coffee
summary: Thai coffee, as is served in Thai restaurants.
ingredient: 2 tablespoons ground coffee beans + ¼ teaspoon ground cardamom + water + 2 tablespoons sweetened condensed milk

name: Blended Mocha Drink
summary: Easy delicious way to get that great pick-me-up without spending a ton of money!
ingredient: ¾ cup brewed espresso + ¼ cup sweetened condensed milk + 1 cup whole milk + 10 ice cubes, or as needed + 3 tablespoons chocolate syrup, or more to taste

name: Tart Lemon Drop Jelly Shots
summary: FOR ADULTS ONLY! These are so delicious and one of my all time favorite party treats. Enjoy responsibly!
process: prep: 10 mins,cook: 20 mins,additional: 6 hrs 15 mins,total: 6 hrs 45 mins,Servings: 50,Yield: 50 servings
ingredient: 4 cups water + 8 large lemons, cut into 8 wedges each + 3<U+2009>½ cups white sugar + 8 (.25 ounce) packages unflavored gelatin + 4 cups lemon vodka + 1 tablespoon turbinado sugar

name: Gourmet Gelly Shots: Orange Margarita!
summary: Who says a margarita needs to be in a glass?
process: prep: 10 mins,additional: 8 hrs,total: 8 hrs 10 mins,Servings: 12,Yield: 12 servings
ingredient: 1 cup boiling water + 1 (6 ounce) package cherry Jell-O® + ½ cup tequila + ¼ cup triple sec + ¼ cup orange liqueur (such as Grand Marnier®)

name: Tainted Fruit Shots
summary: It's Jello with a kick. Vodka is mixed with any fruit flavored gelatin and drunk in a shot glass.
ingredient: 1 (6 ounce) package fruit flavored Jell-O® mix + 2 cups boiling water + 1<U+2009>¼ cups vodka, chilled + ¾ cup cold water

name: Raspberry Party Shots
summary: A raspberry vodka gelatin shot that is wonderful for parties!
process: prep: 20 mins,cook: 5 mins,additional: 1 hr,total: 1 hr 25 mins,Servings: 10,Yield: 10 party shots
ingredient: 1 (6 ounce) package raspberry flavored Jell-O® mix + 2 cups boiling water + ¾ cup ice water + 1<U+2009>¼ cups raspberry vodka

name: Pudding Shots
summary: If you're looking for a little something special for an adult event and are tired of the traditional gelatin shots, this one's for you! It's quick and easy and tastes GREAT!
ingredient: 1 cup milk + ½ cup Irish cream liqueur (eg. Bailey's®) + ½ cup vodka (eg. Smirnoff®) + 1 (4 serving size) package instant chocolate pudding mix

name: RumChata® Pudding Shots
summary: These are even better than Jell-Ou0026reg; shots. You could also serve these after dinner in place of dessert.
process: prep: 15 mins,additional: 3 hrs,total: 3 hrs 15 mins,Servings: 15,Yield: 15 pudding shots
ingredient: 1 cup milk + 1 cup rum cream liqueur (such as RumChata®) + 1 (4 ounce) package instant chocolate pudding mix + 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping (such as Cool Whip®), thawed

name: Chocolate Pudding Shots
summary: Awesome alternative to Jell-Ou0026reg; shots. Serve in individual serving cups with lids. You may want to provide some plastic spoons. Keep in the freezer.
ingredient: 1 (3.9 ounce) package instant chocolate pudding mix + ¾ cup milk + ¼ cup vodka + ½ cup Irish cream liqueur + 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping, thawed

name: White Russian Pudding Shot
summary: Super fun and unusual treat for cookouts!
ingredient: ¾ cup milk + 1 (3.4 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix + ¼ cup vodka + ½ cup coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®) + 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping (such as Cool Whip®), thawed

name: Buttery Nipple Gourmet Pudding Shots
summary: Butterscotch pudding shots are not just for college.
process: prep: 15 mins,additional: 30 mins,total: 45 mins,Servings: 12,Yield: 12 pudding shots
ingredient: 1<U+2009>¾ cups cold milk + 2 fluid ounces butterscotch schnapps + 2 fluid ounces Irish cream liqueur (such as Bailey's®) + 1 fluid ounce vodka + 1 fluid ounce coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®) + 1 (3.4 ounce) package instant butterscotch pudding mix

name: Margarita Jell-O® Shots
summary: I had to make hundreds of Jell-Ou0026reg; shots for a wedding, so I decided to have fun with them and try out some new mixes. This was my margarita-flavored shot, a bit strong but good if you want variety with your selection. If you want them more palatable, substitute water for a bit of the alcohol.
process: prep: 5 mins,additional: 5 hrs,total: 5 hrs 5 mins,Servings: 15,Yield: 15 shots
ingredient: 1 cup boiling water + 1 (3 ounce) package lime-flavored gelatin mix (such as Jell-O®) + <U+2153> cup tequila + <U+2153> cup triple sec + <U+2153> cup water + 15 plastic shot glasses, or as needed

name: Mangonada Jell-O® Shots
summary: If you like the popular Mexican treat, you will love these! Tastes like a mango margarita in jelly form.
process: prep: 10 mins,cook: 10 mins,additional: 4 hrs,total: 4 hrs 20 mins,Servings: 20,Yield: 20 2-ounce shots
ingredient: ¼ cup water + 2 (.25 ounce) packages unflavored gelatin + 2 cups mango puree + ½ cup white sugar + 1 tablespoon lemon juice + 1 cup vodka + 1 teaspoon chamoy sauce, or to taste + 1 teaspoon chile-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®), or as needed

name: Pina Colada Pudding Shots!
summary: Quick and easy to whip up for a party!
process: prep: 10 mins,additional: 30 mins,total: 40 mins,Servings: 24,Yield: 24 pudding shots
ingredient: ½ cup milk + ½ cup vodka (such as Smirnoff®) + ½ cup pineapple rum (such as Malibu®) + 1 (3.5 ounce) package instant coconut cream pie pudding mix + 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping (such as Cool Whip®), thawed

name: Baileys® and Coffee Jell-O® Shots
summary: If you like Baileysu0026reg; and if you like coffee, you will love these Jell-Ou0026reg; shots. Perfect for St. Paddy's Day!
process: prep: 10 mins,additional: 4 hrs,total: 4 hrs 10 mins,Servings: 8,Yield: 8 shots
ingredient: ½ (1 ounce) package unflavored gelatin (such as Knox ®) + ¼ cup boiling water + ¼ cup Irish cream liqueur (such as Baileys®) + ½ (1 ounce) package unflavored gelatin (such as Knox ®) + ¼ cup strong brewed coffee, boiling + ¼ cup Irish cream liqueur (such as Baileys®)

name: Chocolate-Strawberry-Baileys® Pudding Shots
summary: These creamy chocolate-strawberry pudding shots will be the first to disappear from your party table. Quick, easy, and ready in about 1 hour.
process: prep: 15 mins,additional: 1 hr,total: 1 hr 15 mins,Servings: 16,Yield: 16 servings
ingredient: 1 (3 ounce) package instant chocolate pudding mix + 2 cups cold milk, divided + ½ cup Irish cream liqueur (such as Baileys®) + 1 (8 ounce) container whipped topping (such as Cool Whip®), divided + 1 (3 ounce) package instant strawberry pudding mix + ½ cup strawberries and cream liqueur (such as Baileys®) + 1 tablespoon shaved dark chocolate, or to taste

name: Gourmet Gelly Shots: Grape and Jack
summary: Created for a staff party at the Allrecipes office!
process: prep: 10 mins,additional: 8 hrs,total: 8 hrs 10 mins,Servings: 12,Yield: 12 shots
ingredient: 1 cup boiling water + 2 (6 ounce) boxes grape-flavored Jell-O® mix + 1 cup Tennessee whiskey (such as Jack Daniels ®)

name: Key Lime Pie Jell-O® Shots
summary: Who doesn't love key lime pie? I came up with this recipe because I wanted to make mini key lime pies in Jell-Ou0026reg; shot form. It's delicious and guests will love it! Top with whipped cream and enjoy!
process: prep: 15 mins,additional: 4 hrs,total: 4 hrs 15 mins,Servings: 24,Yield: 24 shots
ingredient: 6 graham crackers + ¼ cup butter, melted, or more to taste + 1 teaspoon white sugar + 1 (3 ounce) package lime-flavored gelatin mix (such as Jell-O®) + 1 package unflavored gelatin (such as Knox®) + 1 cup boiling water + 6 fluid ounces cake-flavored vodka + ¼ cup heavy whipping cream, or to taste

name: St. Patrick's Day Jell-O® Shots
summary: A fun and tasty way of keeping your Jell-O® shots Irish. Just add Jameson® Irish whiskey and Baileys® Strawberries Cream liqueur to your layered shot glasses.
process: prep: 10 mins,additional: 8 hrs,total: 8 hrs 10 mins,Servings: 8,Yield: 8 shots
ingredient: ½ (3 ounce) package lime-flavored gelatin mix (such as Jell-O®) + ½ cup boiling water + ½ cup Irish whiskey (such as Jameson®) + 1 (1 ounce) package unflavored gelatin (such as Knox®) + ½ cup boiling water + ½ cup strawberry cream liqueur (such as Baileys®)

name: Caramel Apple Jell-O® Shots
summary: These caramel-apple Jell-Ou0026reg; shots made with real apples nare great for parties.
process: prep: 20 mins,cook: 5 mins,additional: 8 hrs,total: 8 hrs 25 mins,Servings: 40,Yield: 80 wedges
ingredient: 10 small Granny Smith apples + 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, or as needed + 1 (1 ounce) envelope instant caramel-flavored hot chocolate mix (such as Land O Lakes® Cocoa Classics®) + ½ cup boiling water + ½ cup coconut milk + 1 (.25 ounce) package gelatin (such as Knox ®) + ¼ cup white sugar + 2 drops yellow food coloring + ½ cup butterscotch schnapps

name: Margaritas
summary: I have been asked by everyone, 'How do you make your margaritas?' Everyone says I make the best. I like them, maybe you will too.
ingredient: 1 (6 ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate + 6 fluid ounces tequila + 2 fluid ounces triple sec

name: Ultimate Frozen Strawberry Margarita
summary: A strawberry margarita is the perfect summer cocktail! Made with frozen strawberries and limeade concentrate, this 5-ingredient margarita is ready to refresh you in just minutes. For an extra-sweet presentation, dip the rims of your margarita glasses in powdered sugar.
ingredient: 2 cups ice cubes, or as needed + 6 fluid ounces tequila + 2 fluid ounces triple sec + 8 ounces frozen sliced strawberries in syrup + 4 fluid ounces frozen limeade concentrate

name: Beer Margaritas
summary: Who would believe that beer would be the perfect solution to eradicating fluorescent green margaritas? Well, it is! Best to use not-so-micro brews to avoid an overpowering beer flavor. Use the limeade can to measure the ingredients, and adjust with extra water if the mixture seems too sweet. Straining the pulp is always a good idea, unless, of course, you like pulp!
ingredient: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate + 12 fluid ounces tequila + 12 fluid ounces water + 12 fluid ounces beer + ice + 1 lime, cut into wedges

name: The Perfect Margarita
summary: With the right margarita ingredients (fresh limes and high-quality tequila and triple sec) and the right ratios, you can easily master the best margarita! The classic recipe is 3 parts tequila, 2 parts triple sec, and 1 part freshly squeezed lime juice (3:2:1), and you should probably start off pretty close to that. My favorite ratio for a perfect margarita is 4:3:2.
ingredient: 1 wedge lime + 1 teaspoon coarse sea salt, or as needed + 1 large ice cube + 1 cup ice cubes, or as needed + 2 fluid ounces white tequila + 1<U+2009>½ fluid ounces triple sec + 1 fluid ounce freshly squeezed lime juice + 1 slice lime

name: Frozen Strawberry Margarita
summary: We serve these when friends come over and they are always sure to liven up a party!
ingredient: 6 fluid ounces tequila + 2 fluid ounces triple sec + 8 ounces frozen strawberries + 4 fluid ounces frozen limeade concentrate + 6 cups ice

name: Pitcher Perfect Margaritas
summary: After tweaking with several other margarita recipes, I finally found a way to get that 'real' margarita taste in a pitcher size for parties.
ingredient: 2 cups tequila + 1 cup triple sec + ¾ cup fresh lime juice + ¾ cup sweetened lime juice + 3 cups ice + kosher salt + 8 lime wedges

name: Beer Margaritas
summary: Who would believe that beer would be the perfect solution to eradicating fluorescent green margaritas? Well, it is! Best to use not-so-micro brews to avoid an overpowering beer flavor. Use the limeade can to measure the ingredients, and adjust with extra water if the mixture seems too sweet. Straining the pulp is always a good idea, unless, of course, you like pulp!
ingredient: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate + 12 fluid ounces tequila + 12 fluid ounces water + 12 fluid ounces beer + ice + 1 lime, cut into wedges

name: Orange Margarita
summary: I love the fresh taste of orange margaritas. If you like your margarita sweet, add a sugar rim to the glasses instead of the classic salt rim.
ingredient: coarse salt + 2 orange wedges + 3 ounces freshly squeezed orange juice + 3 ounces tequila + 1<U+2009>½ ounces orange-flavored liqueur (such as Cointreau®) + crushed ice

name: Margarita Cocktail
summary: Served straight up or on the rocks, the margarita is one of the most popular cocktails of all time. And for good reason! It will cool you down on a hot day or warm you up on a cool day. Any day is a good day for a margarita.
ingredient: 1 tablespoon kosher salt + 1<U+2009>½ fluid ounces tequila + 1 fluid ounce orange flavored liqueur (such as Cointreau®) + ½ fluid ounce lime juice + 1 cup ice + 1 lime wheel

name: Prickly Pear Cactus Margarita
summary: I had this drink in Tucson and talked the bartender into sharing the recipe with me.
ingredient: coarse salt as needed + 2 fluid ounces tequila + 2 fluid ounces sweet and sour mix + 1 fluid ounce triple sec + 1 fluid ounce lime juice + 1 fluid ounce prickly pear syrup

name: Easy Frozen Margaritas
summary: Authentic margaritas call for lots of fresh lime juice - both expensive and time-consuming. I've found I can shortcut the process by using frozen limeade. And for a festive non-alcoholic drink, combine a 12-ounce can of limeade (thawed) with a 48-ounce bottle of sparkling water.
ingredient: 2 quarts ice cubes + 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate + 12 fluid ounces tequila (measure with empty limeade can) + ¼ cup Cointreau + margarita or kosher salt for the rims + lime slices cut in half

name: The Perfect Blended Margarita
summary: This beats any pre-made margarita mix you can find. I prefer mine straight-up, but you can add salt to the rim if you like.
ingredient: 1<U+2009>¼ cups fresh lime juice + 1 cup Triple Sec or other orange liqueur + 1 cup silver tequila + 3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice + 3 cups ice cubes

name: The Ultimate Margarita
summary: The name says it all--quality ingredients yield the best margarita!
ingredient: ½ fluid ounce Gran Gala Triple Orange Liqueur + 2 fluid ounces Corazon Blanco Tequila + 1 fluid ounce fresh lime juice + 1 fluid ounce agave nectar or simple syrup

name: Bucket of Margaritas
summary: These slushy margaritas are made in the freezer. No blending required! But they must be made ahead to allow time to freeze.
process: prep: 5 mins,additional: 1 day,total: 1 day 5 mins,Servings: 6,Yield: 6 servings
ingredient: 4<U+2009>½ cups water + 1<U+2009>½ cups tequila + 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen limeade + ½ cup triple sec (orange-flavored liqueur) + 1 whole lime, cut into 6 wedges

name: Parker's Famous Margaritas
summary: This is the signature drink at my in-law's home. My father-in-law developed a taste for margaritas made from scratch during the summer they spent in Zihuatanejo during the 1960s. After decades of tinkering he has arrived at this foolproof recipe for the ultimate Mexican cocktail.
ingredient: 5 fluid ounces tequila + 3 fluid ounces fresh lime juice + 1 fluid ounce sweetened lime juice + 3 fluid ounces triple sec (orange-flavored liqueur) + ice cubes + 1 lime, cut into wedges + rimming salt

name: Presidente Margarita
summary: If you love a famous Mexican food chain's 'presidential' margarita, you'll love this recipe. The key is good tequila and brandy.
ingredient: salt for rimming glass + 3 cubes ice, or as desired + 4 fluid ounces sweet-and-sour cocktail mix + 1<U+2009>¼ fluid ounces tequila + ½ fluid ounce orange-flavored liqueur (such as Cointreau®) + ½ fluid ounce brandy (such as Presidente®) + 1 splash lime juice

name: Banana Margaritas
summary: An unusual twist to a classic drink! Watch out, these will sneak up on you!
ingredient: 6 fluid ounces tequila + 1 (6 ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate + 4 fluid ounces triple sec liqueur + 6 cups ice + 2 bananas + ¼ cup coarse granulated sugar

name: Basic Margarita
summary: This is a basic margarita recipe. You can add your favorite fresh fruits to flavor it. Fresh strawberry or mango are good choices. For a little something different, try granulated sugar rims on the glasses instead of margarita salt.
ingredient: 5 fluid ounces tequila + 3 fluid ounces triple sec + 2 (6 ounce) cans frozen limeade concentrate + 4 cups ice cubes + coarse salt

name: Watermelon Margaritas
summary: Perfect summer drink.
ingredient: 2 cups cubed seeded watermelon + 2 cups crushed ice + <U+2153> cup tequila + ¼ cup white sugar + ¼ cup lime juice + 1 tablespoon vodka + 1 tablespoon orange liqueur

name: Blue Lagoon Margaritas
summary: Amazing summer drink. Beautiful and delicious.
ingredient: 2 fluid ounces sour mix + 1<U+2009>½ fluid ounces pineapple juice + 1<U+2009>¼ fluid ounces tequila + 1 fluid ounce Blue Curacao + ½ fluid ounce lime juice + 1 cup ice, or more if desired

name: Creamy Coconut Margarita
summary: A refreshing cross between a margarita and a pina colada!
ingredient: 1 (15 ounce) can cream of coconut (such as Coco Lopez®) + 1 cup ice + ¾ cup tequila (such as Sauza® 100% Blue Agave) + ½ cup freshly squeezed lime juice + ¼ cup brandy-based orange liqueur (such as Grand Marnier®)

name: Lauren's Grapefruit Margaritas
summary: Grapefruit and lime are the perfect refreshing combination for this margarita. Fresh juices taste so much better than store-bought.
ingredient: 1 cup fresh grapefruit juice + 1 cup fresh lime juice + ½ cup triple sec + ½ cup tequila + 1 tablespoon agave syrup + 1 cup ice cubes + 1 tablespoon pomegranate seeds

name: Frozen Banana Margaritas
summary: We enjoyed banana margaritas while vacationing in Mazatlan Mexico and have been trying to duplicate them every since. This recipe brings back great memories. Serve in salt or sugar rimmed margarita glasses.
ingredient: 2 tablespoons lemon juice + 2 tablespoons lime juice + ¾ cup banana liqueur + ½ cup tequila + ¼ cup triple sec (orange-flavored liqueur) + 6 ice cubes + 2 large bananas

name: Margarita Jell-O® Shots
summary: I had to make hundreds of Jell-Ou0026reg; shots for a wedding, so I decided to have fun with them and try out some new mixes. This was my margarita-flavored shot, a bit strong but good if you want variety with your selection. If you want them more palatable, substitute water for a bit of the alcohol.
process: prep: 5 mins,additional: 5 hrs,total: 5 hrs 5 mins,Servings: 15,Yield: 15 shots
ingredient: 1 cup boiling water + 1 (3 ounce) package lime-flavored gelatin mix (such as Jell-O®) + <U+2153> cup tequila + <U+2153> cup triple sec + <U+2153> cup water + 15 plastic shot glasses, or as needed

name: Margarita On The Rocks
summary: A successful and upscale Mexican cantina nearby makes the best margaritas I've ever tasted. They look, smell, and taste 'purer' than any others I've had. I always assumed they were using all top-shelf ingredients, until I found out their secret. . . lemon-lime soda! Now I'm able to re-create them at home.
ingredient: 1 pinch kosher salt for rimming glasses + ice cubes + ½ cup silver tequila + ¼ cup sweetened lime juice (such as Rose's®) + ¼ cup triple sec + ¼ cup lemon-lime soda, or to taste

name: Top Shelf Margaritas on the Rocks
summary: Top Shelf Margaritas sure to please the avid 'rita fanatic; as with anything, fresh ingredients are the key to a quality result, so we start with our own syrup and sour mix.
ingredient: <U+2154> cup sugar + <U+2153> cup water + 2<U+2009>¼ cups water + 1<U+2009>½ cups fresh lemon juice + ¼ cup sugar + 1 egg white + 2 cups ice cubes + 2 cups premium tequila + 1 cup Cointreau + ½ cup lime juice + 16 lime wedges + coarse kosher salt

name: Spicy Mezcal Margarita
summary: Hot peppers and mezcal, a smokier version of tequila, make this the perfect summer cocktail.
ingredient: 1 tablespoon white sugar + 1 teaspoon kosher salt + 1 lime wedge + 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and roughly chopped + 1<U+2009>½ teaspoons white sugar + ½ cup freshly squeezed orange juice + ¼ cup mezcal + 3 tablespoons freshly squeezed lime juice

name: Kiwi Margarita
summary: What do you do when you find yourself with 5 pounds of kiwis? Make margaritas! With a zippy kick-in-the-pants, this is a great new way to enjoy an old favorite.
ingredient: ½ cup superfine sugar + <U+2153> cup gold tequila + <U+2153> cup triple sec + 2 large kiwis, peeled + 1 cup fresh lime juice + 2 cups small ice cubes

name: Italian Amaretto Margaritas
summary: Amaretto gives this drink a fun twist! Frosty glasses rimmed with amaretto and sugar make this drink even better.
ingredient: 4 fluid ounces amaretto liqueur, plus additional + white sugar + 6 fluid ounces frozen limeade concentrate + 6 fluid ounces tequila + ½ cup orange juice + 6 cups ice

name: Mommy's Lemonade (Margaritas)
summary: This is the recipe that I use for all of our get-togethers that is so quick and easy and always gets rave reviews. Enjoy!
ingredient: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate (such as Minute Maid®), thawed + 3 (12 fluid ounce) cans cold water + 1 (12 fluid ounce) can tequila (such as Cuervo® Especial) + ½ (12 fluid ounce) can brandy-based orange liqueur (such as Grand Marnier®) + ice cubes + 1 pinch kosher salt for rimming glasses + 1 lime, cut into wedges

name: Mangorita
summary: Authentic south of the border Mango Margaritas.
ingredient: 2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers tequila + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger triple sec liqueur + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger fresh lime juice + 1 mango - peeled, seeded, and sliced + 4 ice cubes + ¼ cup mango nectar

name: Joe's Perfect 'Anti-Sour Mix' Margarita
summary: Tired of mediocre margaritas with stomach-upsetting sour mix? Try this perfect margarita recipe on the rocks!
ingredient: kosher salt + 1 cup ice cubes + 2 fluid ounces silver tequila + 1 fluid ounce orange liqueur + 1 fluid ounce sweetened lime juice (such as Rose's®) + 2 ounces grapefruit flavored soda

name: Strawberry Basil Margarita
summary: I created this one night to use up some summer strawberries and some of my basil. What a refreshing and delicious summer drink! I know it sounds unusual, but try it and see!
ingredient: 1 cup hulled strawberries + ¼ cup tequila + 1 tablespoon orange-flavored liqueur, such as Cointreau ® + 1 tablespoon lemon juice + 2 tablespoons white sugar + 3 large basil leaves + 8 ice cubes

name: Strawberry Beer Margaritas
summary: Beer margaritas get a flavorful twist with strawberries! Change the flavors by changing the fruit. Mangoes or raspberries work nicely as well!
process: prep: 10 mins,additional: 2 hrs,total: 2 hrs 10 mins,Servings: 6,Yield: 6 servings
ingredient: 1 pound fresh strawberries, hulled and cut into chunks + 12 fluid ounces white tequila + 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage + 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle light beer + 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate, thawed + ice, or as needed + 1 teaspoon kosher salt for rimming glasses

name: World's Greatest Martini
summary: Use a good quality gin in this adult beverage. A twist of lemon zest is an alternative to the olive garnish.
ingredient: 8 fluid ounces gin + ½ fluid ounce dry vermouth + ½ fluid ounce sweet vermouth + 4 cups ice cubes + 4 pimento-stuffed green olives

name: Dan Fay Martini
summary: My father believes in a condition called 'the gin meanies.' He invented this cocktail to satisfy his taste for gin, while allowing him to slightly dilute its effects with vodka. His passion for this concoction quickly spread to my friends, who have been known to throw parties solely to celebrate him and his martini.
ingredient: 2 fluid ounces vodka + 1<U+2009>½ fluid ounces gin + ice cubes + 2 twists lemon peel + 4 pimento-stuffed green olives

name: Meyer Lemon Martini
summary: Meyer lemons, a cross between a lemon and an orange, have a sweeter, less acidic flavor than the more common lemon. If you have to use a regular lemon, add a little extra sugar to taste. For the ultimate martini, use good quality vodka and orange liqueur. I should have named this the 'come to mama' martini!
ingredient: 2 teaspoons white sugar + 2 teaspoons warm water + 1 Meyer lemon, juiced and peeled + 2 fluid ounces vodka + 1 fluid ounce orange-flavored liqueur (such as Cointreau®) + ice + 1 teaspoon white sugar, or as needed for rimming

name: Chocolate Martini a la Laren
summary: Chocolate HEAVEN! I used to work at a fine dining restaurant. The bartender used to create special drinks just for me since he knew I was a light drinker. He concocted this recipe and I've been hooked ever since! Chocolate Martinis ROCK!
ingredient: 4 fluid ounces chocolate liqueur + 3 fluid ounces vodka + 1 (1 ounce) square semisweet chocolate, grated

name: Shaggy's Perfect Martini
summary: A cool refreshing cocktail that will remove the furrows from your brow. Use only the best quality gin. Note: Skewering the olive with a toothpick makes it easier to pick out when you're ready to eat it.
ingredient: ½ fluid ounce dry vermouth + 4 fluid ounces gin + 2 pimento-stuffed green olives

name: Vodka Martini Cocktail
summary: A vodka martini is a classic cocktail and easy to make with just vodka, dry vermouth, and ice. Serve in a chilled martini glass and garnish with olives or a lemon twist for an elegant cocktail at home.
ingredient: 3 fluid ounces vodka + 1 fluid ounce dry vermouth + 1 cup ice cubes + 3 small olives

name: Dirty Martini
summary: This is a dirty martini for olive lovers. It can be served on the rocks or chilled.
ingredient: 6 fluid ounces vodka + 1 dash dry vermouth + 1 fluid ounce brine from olive jar + 4 stuffed green olives

name: Earl Grey Martini
summary: This 'martini' is perfect for fans of Earl Grey tea!
process: prep: 10 mins,additional: 2 hrs,total: 2 hrs 10 mins,Servings: 2,Yield: 2 cocktails
ingredient: 1 teaspoon Earl Grey tea leaves + 2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers gin + white sugar, for rimming + 1 wedge lemon + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger fresh lemon juice + 2 fluid ounces simple syrup

name: Lychee Martini
summary: Are you tired of paying upwards of $15.00 for a drink at those trendy restaurants and bars? This drink is refreshing, Asian-inspired, and sure to impress your guests or that someone special!
ingredient: 5 ice cubes + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger vodka + 1 fluid ounce peach schnapps + 1 fluid ounce white cranberry juice + 1 ounce lychee juice (from a can of lychees) + 1 lychee, for garnish

name: Cranberry Martini
summary: I had this cranberry martini recipe at a holiday party and everyone loved it. The cranberry juice mixes nicely with the liquor. It's a perfect smooth drink.
ingredient: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger vodka + ½ fluid ounce orange liqueur + ½ fluid ounce dry vermouth + 2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers cranberry juice + 1 cup ice + cranberries

name: Dill Pickle Martini
summary: Surprisingly good!
ingredient: 2 cups ice + 1<U+2009>½ fluid ounces dill pickle juice + 4<U+2009>½ fluid ounces vodka + 2 dill pickle spears

name: Stoli Doli
summary: Quick and easy martini made with pineapple infused vodka that is sure to please!
process: prep: 15 mins,additional: 3 days,total: 3 days 15 mins,Servings: 6,Yield: 6 servings
ingredient: 1 fresh pineapple, cut into pieces + 1 (750 milliliter) bottle good quality vodka

name: Chocolate Martini Cocktail
summary: This liquid dessert combines chocolate-flavored liqueurs with vodka and half-and-half for a boozy and decadent drink.
ingredient: 1<U+2009>½ fluid ounces chocolate liqueur + 1<U+2009>½ fluid ounces creme de cacao + ½ fluid ounce vodka + 2<U+2009>½ fluid ounces half-and-half + 1 cup ice

name: Pineapple Upside-down Cake Martinis
summary: This is an easy girlie drink made up by a good friend after she had one at a bar. Pineapple juice and vanilla vodka in a martini glass. Garnish with a wedge of pineapple and a cherry.
ingredient: <U+2154> cup pineapple juice, chilled + <U+2153> cup vanilla flavored vodka + 1 dash grenadine syrup + 2 pineapple wedges + 2 maraschino cherries

name: Classy Lemon Drop Martini
summary: This is my signature lemon drop martini recipe - classic and refreshing!
ingredient: ½ cup vodka + ½ cup citrus vodka + ½ cup prepared lemonade + ¼ cup limoncello liqueur + ¼ cup lemon juice + ¼ cup simple syrup + 1<U+2009>½ cups ice as needed + 4 slices lemon

name: Pickletini
summary: Like a dirty martini, but with pickle juice. If you like pickles, you'll love this pickletini!
ingredient: ice + 2<U+2009>½ fluid ounces premium vodka + 1 fluid ounce pickle juice + 3 pickle slices

name: Pumpkin Spice Martini
summary: A fun, delicious cocktail for your next holiday gathering. A good friend shared this great idea!
ingredient: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger vanilla flavored vodka (such as Stoli®) + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger Irish cream liqueur (such as Bailey's®) + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger pumpkin flavored liqueur (such as Hiram Walker®) + 1 cup ice cubes + 1 pinch ground cinnamon + 1 pinch ground nutmeg

name: Italian Wedding Cake Martini
summary: This delicious cocktail tastes just like an Italian wedding cake cookie!
ingredient: 2 fluid ounces vanilla vodka + 1 fluid ounce cranberry juice + 1 fluid ounce pineapple juice + ½ fluid ounce amaretto (almond flavored liqueur) + ½ fluid ounce white creme de cacao

name: The Milky Way Martini
summary: This Milky Way martini is a wickedly good and dangerous drink that'll leave you seeing stars!
ingredient: 1<U+2009>½ cups ice cubes + ¼ cup cold water + 2 fluid ounces vanilla-flavored vodka + 2 fluid ounces white creme de cacao + 2 fluid ounces Irish cream liqueur + 1 tablespoon chocolate syrup

name: French Martini
summary: I had this wonderful raspberry martini in the Garden District of New Orleans and knew I had to get the recipe from the 5-star restaurant. Turns out, my new favorite is simple to make!
ingredient: ice cubes + 2 fluid ounces vodka + 2 fluid ounces fresh pineapple juice + ½ fluid ounce raspberry-flavored liqueur (such as Chambord®) + 1 slice fresh pineapple + 1 (3 inch) lemon peel

name: Easy Watermelon Martini
summary: Simple and delicious cocktail. Perfect for a hot summer day. You can garnish with a small piece of watermelon.
ingredient: 1 slice watermelon, rind removed + ½ cup ice cubes, or as needed + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger vodka

name: Blueberry Vodka Martinis
summary: These blueberry martinis are the hit of any party! Easy to make, but the key is the homemade blueberry vodka that requires 2 weeks to properly infuse. After that, it's smooth and fruity sailing with a splash of lime juice!
process: prep: 30 mins,additional: 1 week,total: 1 week 30 mins,Servings: 10,Yield: 10 servings
ingredient: 1 liter vodka + 1 pint blueberries, rinsed and dried + 1 cup raspberry flavored liqueur + 1 lime, juiced + 1 twist lime zest, garnish

name: Watermelon Vodka Martini
summary: If you like watermelon you're going to love this refreshing martini made with fresh watermelon juice, watermelon-infused simple syrup, your favorite vodka with a Tajin® rimmed glass. This is the perfect cocktail for summer fun on the patio with family and friends.
process: prep: 10 mins,cook: 5 mins,additional: 30 mins,total: 45 mins,Servings: 2,Yield: 2 watermelon vodka martinis
ingredient: 1 seedless watermelon, cut into cubes + 1 cup coconut sugar + ½ cup water + 3 fluid ounces vodka + 1 splash fresh lime juice + 1 cup ice cubes, or as needed + 1 tablespoon chili-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®)

name: Austin Margarita (aka Mexican Martini)
summary: After living in Austin Texas for 10 years, my husband and I perfected the perfect margarita. The secret to success is fresh fruit juice only and it doesn't use any pre-made mixes! Don't skimp and try buying juice. Squeeze it yourself or you won't get the best taste! If you are a real olive lover, add pimento stuffed olives and call it a 'Mexican martini'...delicious! and you won't confuse yours with anyone else's if you add 3 olives on a stirrer. :)
ingredient: ½ cup ice cubes + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger silver tequila + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger Cointreau + 2 teaspoons Grand Marnier liqueur + 2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers freshly squeezed lime juice + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger freshly squeezed orange juice + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger freshly squeezed lemon juice + 3 pimento-stuffed green olives

name: Lemony Lemon Drop Martini
summary: Soooo lemony! This is nice and tart yet very refreshing.
ingredient: 1 tablespoon white sugar + 1 cup ice cubes + 3 lemons, peel grated and juiced + 2 large mint leaves + 2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers vodka + 2 tablespoons simple syrup

name: Thin Mint Martini
summary: This tastes just like a Thin Mintu0026reg; Girl Scout cookie!
ingredient: 1 teaspoon chocolate syrup, or to taste + 1 fluid ounce peppermint schnapps + 2 fluid ounces chocolate liqueur + 2 fluid ounces half-and-half

name: Chocolate Covered Cherry Martini
summary: This martini tastes like chocolate-covered cherries. I made the recipe up as I went along. Now it's the most requested martini at the bar I work at.
ingredient: 1 cup ice cubes + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger chocolate vodka + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger cherry vodka + ½ fluid ounce grenadine syrup + 1 fluid ounce creme de cacao + 1 fluid ounce half-and-half + 1 dash chocolate syrup + 1 maraschino cherry + 1 chocolate kiss candy

name: Concord Cosmopolitan Martini
summary: Great martini or cosmo depending where you live! I use Ciroc vodka which isn't like any other vodka because it is distilled from fine French grapes. You can actually taste the grape in the vodka!
ingredient: 2<U+2009>½ fluid ounces vodka + 1 fluid ounce Cointreau or other orange liqueur + 4 fluid ounces Concord grape juice

name: Tiramisu Martini
summary: Smooooooooooth chocolate martini.
ingredient: 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger vanilla flavored vodka + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger creme de cacao + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger coffee flavored liqueur

name: Mexican Martinis
summary: These are a bit labor intensive but worth it. Fresh limes and a good lime squeezer are a must.
ingredient: 4 limes, juiced + coarse salt + 2 jalapeno-stuffed green olives + 2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers premium tequila + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger orange liqueur + 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger sweetened lime juice + ½ teaspoon superfine sugar + crushed ice

name: Vicki's Tangerine Martini
summary: This is an adult crowd pleaser and my answer to what to do with all the tangerines on my tree. It is refreshing and oh, so good!
ingredient: ice + 3 fluid ounces freshly squeezed tangerine juice + 1<U+2009>½ fluid ounces vodka + 1 teaspoon orange-flavored liqueur (such as Cointreau®)

name: Tropical Martini
summary: This is a dessert in a glass! The grenadine looks beautiful, plus it balances out the fruit juices to give it a wonderful full-body flavor, so don't skip this step! Garnishes are welcome, for example: whole strawberry on the side of the glass, chunk of fresh pineapple, etc.
ingredient: 1 ounce mango puree + 1 fluid ounce vodka + 1 fluid ounce pineapple juice + 1 fluid ounce passion fruit juice + ½ cup ice as needed + 1 splash grenadine syrup

name: Tito's Martini
summary: Enjoy Tito's Handmade Vodka martini-style. Garnish with one or three olives, but never two.
ingredient: 3 ounces Tito's Handmade Vodka + 1 ounce (or less) dry vermouth + 1 cup ice cubes + 3 small olives

name: Snickers® Martini
summary: A strong but good coffee-flavored martini!
ingredient: 1 fluid ounce coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®) + 1 fluid ounce Irish cream liqueur + 1 fluid ounce amaretto liqueur + 1 fluid ounce hazelnut liqueur (such as Frangelico®) + ½ fluid ounce vodka + 1 teaspoon heavy whipping cream, or to taste

name: Rhubarb-Infused 'Barbtini
summary: This is great for using up that extra rhubarb! It's a very kicky twist on a Cosmopolitan, and you can use the syrup to add a spark to any of your favorite drinks, from vodka lemonade to margaritas. The syrup makes enough for 12 cocktails, so invite your friends over!
ingredient: 2 cups water + 1 cup white sugar + 2 cups thinly sliced rhubarb + 1<U+2009>½ fluid ounces good-quality vodka + ½ fluid ounce triple sec liqueur + 1 cup crushed ice

name: Kelly's Super Simple Shower Punch
summary: This is a fabulously simple and delicious punch. It has only 2 ingredients!
ingredient: 1 pint raspberry sorbet + 1 (2 liter) bottle lemon-lime soda

name: Orange Dream Punch
summary: This is the easiest punch recipe ever. It was a big hit at my sister's bridal shower.
ingredient: ½ gallon orange sherbet + 1 (6 ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate + 1 (2 liter) bottle ginger ale

name: Giggle Floats
summary: This is a 'girly drink' made with cheap wine and sherbet, very refreshing, very easy to make, and perfect for all-girl gatherings like bachelorette parties! Any flavor of wine and sherbet can be used.
ingredient: 8 scoops orange sherbet + 1 (750 milliliter) bottle fruit-flavored wine (such as Arbor Mist®)

name: Banana Slush Punch
summary: This banana punch is a favorite recipe of my late mother-in-law's family, used for all celebrations.
ingredient: 4 ripe bananas + 2 cups white sugar + 3 cups water + 1 (46 fluid ounce) can pineapple juice + 2 (12 fluid ounce) cans frozen orange juice concentrate + 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate + 3 cups water + 3 liters ginger ale

name: Grandmother's Punch
summary: My Grandmother found this recipe and makes it every year at Christmas. It is a family favorite, and kids love it.
ingredient: 2 (0.13 ounce) packages unsweetened strawberry-flavored drink mix powder + 2<U+2009>½ cups white sugar + 4 quarts cold water + 2 (6 ounce) cans frozen orange juice concentrate + 2 (6 ounce) cans frozen pineapple juice concentrate + 3 oranges, sliced into rounds + 1 liter ginger ale + ½ gallon orange sherbet

name: Planter's Punch
summary: I make this fun and refreshing drink every 4th of July. It starts out with a slush base. The bitters off-set the sweetness just the right amount, and it's a beautiful color. Can be served in a punch bowl, or individual servings. Garnish with cherries, orange slices or other desired fresh fruit.
process: prep: 10 mins,additional: 8 hrs,total: 8 hrs 10 mins,Servings: 12,Yield: 12 servings
ingredient: 1 (6 ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate + 14 fluid ounces water + 1<U+2009>½ cups rum + ¾ cup grenadine syrup + ½ cup lime juice + 1 tablespoon aromatic bitters + 2 liters club soda

name: Sparkling Punch
summary: Sparkling apple cider, fresh orange juice, and lemonade concentrate blend into light and refreshing non-alcoholic punch in this easy recipe.
ingredient: 2 lemons + 3 large oranges + 1 (6 ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate + 1 liter club soda + 2 (750 milliliter) bottles sparkling apple cider + 1 tablespoon white sugar + 2 trays ice cubes

name: Budget Jungle Juice for a Crowd
summary: This jungle juice recipe makes a great alcoholic punch that will serve many on a limited budget. Serve chilled or add vanilla ice cream if you wish.
ingredient: 2 gallons orange-flavored drink + 4 quarts pink lemonade + 4 quarts pineapple and orange juice blend + 4 (750 milliliter) bottles vodka + 2 (750 milliliter) bottles white rum + 2 (46 fluid ounce) cans fruit punch

name: Berrylicious Frozen Sangria Slush
summary: This boozy, fruity frozen sangria is an adult version of the icy slushies we slurped down as kids. So refreshing on a hot summer night. Cheers!
ingredient: 1 cup red wine + 1 cup ice cubes, crushed + <U+2153> cup frozen blueberries + <U+2153> cup fresh raspberries + <U+2153> cup frozen strawberries + ¼ cup orange-flavored liqueur + ½ orange, juiced + 1 tablespoon white sugar, or more to taste

name: Jamaican Rum Punch
summary: A tropical rum punch made with three varieties of rum, grenadine, pineapple juice, fresh lime juice, and orange juice for a refreshingly fruity party drink. Fresh lime juice is key to getting the unique flavor of this punch.
ingredient: 2<U+2009>½ cups pineapple juice + 2<U+2009>½ cups orange juice + 1 cup 151 proof rum (such as Bacardi®) + ½ cup dark rum (such as Meyer's®) + ¼ cup coconut-flavored rum (such as Malibu®) + ¼ cup fresh lime juice + 3 tablespoons grenadine syrup + 1 orange, sliced + 1 lime, sliced + 1 lemon, sliced

name: Luau Punch
summary: This slushy fruit punch has been used for years by my family at birthday parties, summer gatherings and now my children ask for it at breakfast...it is our favorite punch. We make it in an empty gallon milk jug.
ingredient: 1 (46 fluid ounce) can pineapple juice + 1 (6 ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed + 2 liters lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage

name: Fruit Punch
summary: Cool and easy recipe. Everyone always loves it, especially my niece.
ingredient: 1 (64 fluid ounce) bottle fruit punch, chilled + 1 (64 fluid ounce) bottle unsweetened pineapple juice, chilled + 1 (2 liter) bottle ginger ale, chilled + ½ gallon orange sherbet

name: Watermelon Sangria
summary: This is one of my favorite recipes I have borrowed from a friend. If you love watermelon, this is the perfect drink for a hot summer day!
process: prep: 20 mins,additional: 4 hrs,total: 4 hrs 20 mins,Servings: 16,Yield: 16 servings
ingredient: 12 cups cubed watermelon, divided + 1 (750 milliliter) bottle dry white wine + 1 cup vodka + ½ cup triple sec + ½ cup simple syrup + 1 medium lime, quartered + 1 orange, cut into wedges + 1 cup fresh blueberries

name: Party Punch III
summary: This is punch is so extremely easy to make that a child could do it, yet it is so delicious. It is always served at our family gatherings, and my sisters, brother and I all had it served at our weddings.
ingredient: 1 (2 liter) bottle fruit punch, chilled + 1 (64 fluid ounce) bottle orange juice, chilled + 1 (2 liter) bottle ginger ale, chilled

name: Rhubarb Slush
summary: This is a refreshing spring time beverage. It is also a great way to use up all that fresh rhubarb. Alcohol is optional.
ingredient: 6 cups fresh rhubarb, chopped + 2 cups white sugar + 1 (6 ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed + 1 (6 ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed + 1 cup gin + 3 cups water + 1 (2 liter) bottle lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage, chilled

name: White Peachy Sangria
summary: This sweet and yummy recipe is good for even those that do not like wine. Great on a hot day or paired with a dessert, ESPECIALLY a cheesecake or something fruity!
process: prep: 30 mins,additional: 8 hrs,total: 8 hrs 30 mins,Servings: 20,Yield: 20 servings
ingredient: 4 (750 milliliter) bottles moscato wine + 4 (12 fluid ounce) cans or bottles lemon-lime soda (such as Sprite®) + 1 cup brandy + 1 cup peach schnapps + 2 fresh peaches, pitted and sliced + 1 (16 ounce) package fresh strawberries, sliced + 2 mangos - peeled, seeded, and sliced + ½ fresh pineapple - peeled, cored, and cut into chunks + 1 (6 ounce) container fresh raspberries

name: White Sangria
summary: WONDERFUL!!! A wonderful punch made with white wine, mango and orange slices. Peach schnapps, cognac and ginger ale round out this summer party drink.
process: prep: 30 mins,additional: 1 hr,total: 1 hr 30 mins,Servings: 32,Yield: 1 gallon
ingredient: ½ cup peach schnapps + ½ cup cognac + ¼ cup white sugar + 4 oranges, sliced into rounds + 2 mangos, peeled and sliced + 4 (750 milliliter) bottles dry white wine, chilled + 1 liter ginger ale, chilled

name: Pineapple Sangria
summary: Easy sangria recipe that can be easily altered based on fruit you have on hand and personal taste.
process: prep: 25 mins,additional: 8 hrs,total: 8 hrs 25 mins,Servings: 8,Yield: 1 gallon
ingredient: 2 (750 milliliter) bottles Sauvignon Blanc + 2 cups pineapple juice + 1 cup triple sec + ½ cup brandy + ½ cup chopped fresh pineapple + ½ cup chopped orange + 1 lemon, seeded and chopped + ¼ cup chopped lime + 2 cups lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage (such as 7-Up®)

name: Baby Blue Punch
summary: I created this punch recipe when I went looking for a punch recipe for my Baby Shower. I really wanted blue punch because I was having a boy this time. The ice cream melts somewhat and turns the punch a beautiful baby blue color leaving frothy blue and white clouds floating on top. Everyone thought it tasted great and asked for the recipe. Its also very adaptable to your taste. The sky's the limit. Try any flavor or color of unsweetened drink mix in place of the blue.
ingredient: 1 (0.13 ounce) package blue, berry flavored unsweetened drink mix + 1 (2 liter) bottle lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage + 1 (64 fluid ounce) bottle white cranberry juice + 8 scoops vanilla ice cream + 1 cup white sugar, or to taste

name: Old-Fashioned Pink Lemonade
summary: This is a wonderfully refreshing drink. Serve in pitchers garnished with mint leaves and orange or lemon slices.
ingredient: 2 cups white sugar + 9 cups water + 2 cups fresh lemon juice + 1 cup cranberry juice, chilled

name: Easy Punch
summary: I served this at my grandmother's 90th birthday and everyone wanted the recipe. Use any flavor of drink mix. One variation is to freeze the punch overnight and then set it out an hour before the event.
ingredient: 4 (0.13 ounce) packages unsweetened strawberry-flavored drink mix powder + 2 (46 fluid ounce) cans pineapple juice + 3 cups white sugar + 4 quarts water + 2 liters ginger ale

name: Sangria Cocktail
summary: Sangria is a Spanish wine punch that includes chopped fruit and sparkling water for a refreshing summertime cooler.
